item.title: Marathon Release Date Set for March
item.content:encoded:
Bungie has revealed the Marathon release date (again), with the extraction shooter getting ready to deploy on PC and consoles in March.

As announced in a brand new blog post, Marathon will be launching on March 5th. If you're so inclined, pre-orders for the game are open now as well, and you'll get extra stuff if you buy the game before its release date hits, including some rewards for Destiny 2.

This announcement marks the second time that Marathon's release date has been revealed; back in April last year, Bungie set a September date for the game, but Marathon was delayed in June following lukewarm feedback from the game's alpha testing period.

As well as the disappointing alpha feedback, Bungie also found itself at the center of controversy in May, when it was revealed that the game contained artwork that had been stolen from an online artist without proper credit.

All of that followed on from news in August 2024 that Marathon's former director Chris Barrett had been fired over misconduct allegations, which led him to sue Sony over his dismissal. Sony promptly responded to the lawsuit, providing evidence of what it called a "pattern of misconduct" on Barrett's part.

This is all to say that Marathon has had a lengthy and difficult development cycle, and with Destiny 2 proving a disappointment to Bungie and Sony in recent years, the two will likely be hoping this one is more of an unqualified success.

You can check out the new pre-order trailer for Marathon, which also introduces a brand new character you'll be meeting a lot in the game, right here.

Assuming that there are no further delays, you'll be able to check out Marathon on March 5th on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. Stay tuned for more on this and all other things Bungie.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He‚Äôs originally an‚Ä¶ More about Joseph

item.title: Marathon Release Date Made Official By Bungie
item.content:encoded:
After it was leaked online over the weekend, Bungie has confirmed the release date of its upcoming extraction shooter Marathon.

In a post on social media, Bungie announced that Marathon will launch on March 5, 2026. In addition to that, they revealed pre-order details for players.

The game is available to pre-order on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. Should you decide to pre-purchase Marathon, you‚Äôll get addition weapon cosmetics, an emblem, and background for the game. You‚Äôll also get new rewards for Destiny 2.

Multiple Marathon Versions To Pick From

When Marathon launches, you have the option to purchase three different editions of the game. The Standard Edition comes with a copy of the game along with ‚Äúall gameplay updates as the year progresses.‚Äù Should you pre-order the game, you‚Äôll also receive:

  • ZERO STEP 004 CE Tactical Sidearm Style
  • ZERO STEP RC Weapon Charm
  • ZERO STEP SHIFT Weapon Sticker
  • APOGEE INTERCEPT Background
  • APOGEE INTERCEPT Emblem
  • UESC Echo-type Shell Exotic Ghost (Destiny 2)
  • UESC Rover Exotic Ship (Destiny 2)
  • UESC Sprinter Exotic Sparrow (Destiny 2)

A step above that is the Deluxe Edition. This version of the game includes:

  • All Standard Edition content
  • 1x Premium Rewards Pass Voucher
  • 200 SILK Rewards Pass Tokens
  • Weapon Cosmetics:
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Misriah 2442 Pump Shotgun Style
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Overrun AR Style
  • Runner Shell Cosmetics:
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Vandal Shell Style
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Destroyer Shell Style
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Assassin Shell Style
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Thief Shell Style

Lastly, the Collector‚Äôs Edition comes with everything from the other two editions of Marathon along with a 1/6-scale Thief Runner Shell statue, a collectible miniature WEAVEworm, an embroidered patch, postcards, and other digital rewards.

Are you going to pick up Marathon when it releases on March 5? Leave your thoughts down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the match types planned to come to WWE 2K26 when it launches in March. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
